reviewText: Outdoor Chattanooga covers not only the Scenic City's transition from the dirtiest city in the USA in the 70s and 80s, but how the city has transformed into a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts of any kind. The documentary covers Chattanooga's biggest outdoor asset -- the Tennessee River -- a haven for kayaking, boating, and enjoying nature, as well as the many mountains and other activities that make Chattanooga a unique place for lovers of the outdoors. This documentary is very well-produced, and features some beautiful scenery that will give you a real feel for how vibrant this great city actually is for residents, tourists, and anyone wanting to spend time outside in nature!
